beliefs.text: Firefighters deployed 128 fire trucks and 57 ambulances to the scene.
The complex was undergoing major renovations.
Hundreds of people were evacuated from the complex of almost 2,000 apartments.
The fire alarm systems at Wang Fuk Court failed to sound, allowing the flames to climb from the lower floors to the roof within minutes.
beliefs.supersedes: The Fire Services Department confirmed that the fire alarm systems at Wang Fuk Court were not functioning during the fire.

beliefs.text: Firefighters have been trying for hours to douse fires at a residential building complex in the Tai Po district.
Debris and scaffolding of the affected buildings are falling down.
Xi Jinping urged authorities in Hong Kong to make every effort to extinguish the blaze.
At least 160 people have died due to a series of events and decisions related to the Wang Fuk Court fire.
beliefs.supersedes: The death toll from the Hong Kong apartment fire has reached 128.

beliefs.text: Most of the residents trapped in the fire were believed to be elderly people.
The fire department received reports of a fire in the residential complex at 2:51 p.m.
The fire was upgraded to a Number 4 alarm at 3:34 p.m.
The fire was still burning in the early hours of Thursday.
76 others were injured in the fire.
Tai Po Baptist Church provided shelter and aid after the fire.
Pastor Jenny Lam Yat-kwan lost three family members in the fire.
More than 60 members of Tai Po Baptist Church lost their homes in the fire.
The fire at Wang Fuk Court became Hong Kong's deadliest fire in decades.
The government would set up a HK$300m fund to help residents.
The fire started on the external scaffolding of Wang Cheong House.
Seven of the eight 32-storey towers in Wang Fuk Court were engulfed in flames.
29 people were still hospitalized, with seven of them in critical condition.
Police Commissioner Joe Chow told reporters that human remains previously believed to belong to one person were revealed to be from two individuals.
beliefs.supersedes: The death toll in the Wang Fuk Court blaze has risen to 160 after DNA tests found one additional fatality.

beliefs.text: Ankara is deeply saddened by the loss of lives caused by the fire.
Türkiye has extended condolences to Hong Kong.
John Lee said more than 900 people had sought refuge at temporary shelters.
Hong Kong leader John Lee announced a judge-led independent committee to investigate the fire.
beliefs.supersedes: John Lee said the government would set up a task force to investigate the fire.

beliefs.text: People attend a vigil near the scene of the deadly fire at the Wang Fuk Court housing complex in Hong Kong on Nov. 28.
Lee Jae Myung extended his condolences following the deadly fire at an apartment complex in Hong Kong.
Authorities have arrested approximately 20 people as part of a criminal investigation into the fire.
beliefs.supersedes: Eight people have been arrested over the Wang Fuk Court fire.

beliefs.text: National security police reportedly arrested three people over the weekend for alleged sedition in relation to the fatal fire.
Miles Kwan organized a petition calling for an independent probe into the blaze.
Investigators found that samples of netting at Wang Fuk Court did not meet legal standards of flame retardancy.

beliefs.text: HKCNP convened a Zoom meeting to connect its affiliated pastors with Tai Po pastors.

China’s national security office summoned foreign media to warn them about spreading false information regarding the Wang Fuk Court fire.
Jimmy Lai turned 78 in a Hong Kong prison.

Chinese media has decried the politicization of the Wang Fuk Court fire.

The people of Hong Kong want answers and accountability.
Another six people were arrested in connection to fire alarms that failed to sound.
The Hong Kong Housing Authority is responsible for overseeing public housing developments.
Police were relatively sure that three of those people lived at Wang Fuk Court complex.

Antony Dapiran noted that accountability for local officials in China can be brutal and short.
China might blame Hong Kong’s laissez-faire regulatory system for the Wang Fuk Court fire.

John Lee was questioned about his leadership in light of the Wang Fuk Court fire.
Hong Kong security chief Chris Tang urged society to stand united in dealing with the aftermath of the Wang Fuk Court fire.
